fields.headline: Terry injury worry
fields.bodyText: John Terry insisted he would be fit to captain Chelsea in the Champions League final with Manchester United despite being carried off in the 1-1 draw against Bolton yesterday with a dislocated elbow. Club medics 'popped' the joint back en route to hospital, where x-rays revealed no broken bones. "Three or four days' rest and I should be OK," said Terry, who was hurt in a collision with Petr Cech. Didier Drogba had ice and a strapping applied to a knock to his knee, which Avram Grant, the manager, said did "not look so good" but the striker said he would be fit for Moscow.
